trans-unit.source: Azure Cloud Services - Service Definition and Service Config - XML Certificate
trans-unit.target: Azure Cloud Services - Service Definition and Service Config - XML Certificate

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure a certificate in the service definition and config files.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure a certificate in the service definition and config files.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Service Definition and Config for a Certificate
trans-unit.target: Configure the Service Definition and Config for a Certificate

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machines that are running your web or worker roles can have certificates associated with them.
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machines that are running your web or worker roles can have certificates associated with them.

trans-unit.source: Once you've uploaded your certificate into the portal, you need to configure the service definition (.csdef) and service config (.cscfg) files for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Once you've uploaded your certificate into the portal, you need to configure the service definition (.csdef) and service config (.cscfg) files for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: The Virtual Machine can access the private key of the certificate after it has been installed.
trans-unit.target: The Virtual Machine can access the private key of the certificate after it has been installed.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, you may want to restrict access to processes with elevated permissions.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, you may want to restrict access to processes with elevated permissions.

trans-unit.source: Service definition example
trans-unit.target: Service definition example

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of a certificate defined in the service definition.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of a certificate defined in the service definition.

trans-unit.source: Permissions
trans-unit.target: Permissions

trans-unit.source: Permissions (permisionLevel attribute) can be set to one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Permissions (permisionLevel attribute) can be set to one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Permission Value
trans-unit.target: Permission Value

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: limitedOrElevated
trans-unit.target: limitedOrElevated

trans-unit.source: (Default) All role processes can access the private key.
trans-unit.target: (Default) All role processes can access the private key.

trans-unit.source: elevated
trans-unit.target: elevated

trans-unit.source: Only elevated processes can access the private key.
trans-unit.target: Only elevated processes can access the private key.

trans-unit.target: Service config example

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of a certificate defined in the service config.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of a certificate defined in the service config.

trans-unit.source: Note the matching name attributes.
trans-unit.target: Note the matching name attributes.
